newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean banks to supply $300 mln to Kia Group.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean banks to supply $300 mln to Kia Group.

text.p: South Korean banks agreed to supply $300 million in export loans to the Kia Group to help ease the group's financial strain, Kia's prime creditor Korea First Bank said on Thursday.
"Five to six banks will extend the loans when Kia presents its shipping documents," a Korea First Bank spokesman said.
He said exports of Kia Motors, the group's flagship, were picking up in recent months and would remain healthy throughout the year.
A financial official at Kia said the group would submit the documents next week.
Kia Motors reported on Tuesday its exports had jumped 343 percent to 40,093 units from 9,048 unit a year ago, when a wildcat strike hampered shipments.
Kia Motors aims to export 450,000 units this year, up from 322,000 units in 1996.
In June, Kia Group, hit by rumours of financial troubles, asked for the government's help to keep its credit lines open.

The group had been rumoured to be in trouble for months, but speculation grew in early June when a report leaked by Samsung Motors alleged "managerial conflicts" at group flagship Kia Motors and hinted of a takeover.
